args: We will now commence the duel between\nEmperor Werner and the scoundrel who\nclaims to be the former emperor!
I'm surprised you didn't turn tail and flee\nlike the craven you are.
That's rich, coming from King Coward!
(Oh, trust me, I very much wanted to run—\nbut SOMEBODY posted guards to make\nsure I couldn't!)
Let me give you an advantage, cur!\nYou may have the first strike.\nCome at me however you will.
You think you're better than me?! You're\nnothing more than a damn MINISTER!
Whaaaat?! He sent my sword flying\nin a single hit!

You seem to have underestimated me.
But now that we have a brief moment,
do you know why I served you as an
official rather than a soldier?

It was to hide my skill with a blade.
Had you ever realized that, your guard
would have been raised and I could not
have caught you unawares as I did.
This match is already mine, but it would\nhardly strike obedience and fear in the\nhearts of the people were I to end it now.
You're still trying to stand? Pathetic!
You never had what it takes to be an\nemperor! You're naught but useless trash!

Guy's pactbound dragon bailed on him,
and then the brother he thought was a
huge chump waxed the floor with him.
Woof! Talk about your rough days.
How come we get saddled with a lousy\ncommander like that? Hell, I'll take a\ntraitor prince over a loser prince any day!
(A truth I see better than anyone.\nI KNOW I'm not fit to be emperor!)
Oh, yes. I thought you might be a king\nof literature, one able to change our\nmilitaristic nation.
Farewell to you, my son. I pray that\nyou become a good and just ruler.
Father! It was you who said that to me!
Well, there's putting fear in hearts,\nand then there's just gilding the lily.\nTime for you to die now.
Hmph. Useless trash to the end.
How?! How are you standing again?!\nJust give up and die already!
Not a chance... I'm not even close to\ngiving up now, you empty-headed dolt.

Oh, I know I'm useless when it comes to
fighting or magic—and I'm painfully
well aware that I don't actually have what
it takes to be an emperor.
But I have someone in my life who\nbelieved I could be a good and just ruler\ndespite all of that.
I have people who told me I had gifts\npossessed by no one else!
And I've found a way to get others\nto see my talent for what it is!
So I'm never giving up on this country!\nNot now, and not EVER!
Your...talent? Oh, this ought to be good.\nAnd what, pray tell, might this talent be?
Aaaah ha ha ha! The arts? THE ARTS?!\nDo you really think you can rule a country\nwith PAINTINGS?!
Cram it, four-eyes! I'm gonna change this\ncountry from the ground up!
I'll turn it into a peaceful nation where the\narts can flourish! The Dyrenell Empire is\nmine to change, and I AM GOING TO DO IT!
Now get your ugly, warmongering mug\nout of my damn throne room!
(Well, no point thinking about it now.\nTime to end this!)
But this worthless runt CAN'T shapeshift!\nHow is this happening?!
A most splendid victory, Your Majesty!
But when did you manage to make\nanother pact with a dragon?
But maybe I just awakened some secret\npower I've always had deep down inside!
The Waterwyrm? Good! I'm GLAD you're\nhere, because now you can explain what\nin the name of caviar just happened!
Oh no. Not him. Anyone but him.
Normally, the pact between a dragon and\na possessor of dragonblood belongs only\nto the two of them.

But it would seem the Windwyrm has
forged a pact stating that any whom
{player_name} deems worthy
may also receive a dragon's power.
Only through a bond of trust can one share\ntheir ability to shapeshift with another.
He has always accepted you as one of\nhis older brothers, which is why you were\nable to shapeshift today.
Wait, but that's not... He would never...\nOH, YOU HAVE TO BE KIDDING ME!
He took everything from me, yet continues\nto show up and give me whatever I want!
He's a miserable little insect with a\nterrible attitude, and I hate that about him!
Your Majesty, I believe you should give\nyour victory speech to the people?
Might I ask a question, Waterwyrm?
Why did the emperor shapeshift into you?
The seventh scion has made pacts with\nnumerous dragons, so why is it that he\ntransformed into you in particular?
The ability to shapeshift in and of itself is \ndue to {player_name}'s pact.
However, we are able to choose who\nwe wish to share our power with.
Regardless of his motivations, Emile has\ndecided to create a nation of peace, and\nso I chose to share my power with him.

Whether I do so again depends on his
actions from here on out. But I was
witness to how hard he worked for this,
so call it something of a...special favor.
It seems the future has finally become\nclear for Emperor Emile, King Aurelius.
People of Dyrenell! I, your beloved\nEmperor Emile, have ousted the pretender!
From this day forth, our country is going to\nchange! We will no longer be a nation of\nendless war, but one of endless peace!
The grand Emperor Emile has made his\nlong-awaited return! Rejoice, my people!
Long live Emperor Emile!\nLong live Emperor Emile!
Some months after Emile's return to the throne
Emperor Emile has really taken a liking\nto those clothes, hasn't he? Er, but were\nthey not originally a disguise?

It's quite impressive how the Waterwyrm
was able to pinpoint what His Majesty
would love in the short amount of time
she was pactbound to him.
Magnus! Quit your idle chitchat and tell\nme how our legislation is progressing!

Of course, Majesty. Discussions between
us and the people's representatives have
been going smoothly, and we should have
something to present very soon.
I must say, you've made quite the decision\nto allow the people to govern themselves.

Hmph. I'm just letting them clean up their
own messes. It should be fine so long as I
check from time to time and ensure all is
running smoothly.
Besides, I was working too hard anyway.\nWe at the top of the heap aren't supposed\nto do everything ourselves, you know!
Indeed, the Dyrenell empire has made\na most spectacular comeback.
And your proactive call for artists and\nopera troupes has turned our capital into\na place of beauty and grace.

The economy has seen a boost as a result,
thus improving the people's quality of life.
Additionally, we've seen an increase in
applicants for the academy.
Of COURSE we have! I need these churls\nto be smart enough to understand my\nartistic finesse and greatness.

To say our neighbors are shocked would be
an understatement; the last thing they ever
thought the Dyrenell Empire would become
is a haven for the arts.
Our country has finally become one\nthat suits you, Majesty.
But you could never become one of them,\nYour Majesty!
(Because I can't be anyone but myself.)

Er, I mean, naturally! I am a genius,
after all, and I'm going to succeed in
something my siblings could not even
begin to conceive of!
Emperor Emile, we've received a message\nfrom Prince Leonidas!
Probably going to tell me to quit while\nI'm ahead, but let's see it...
＂We have sensed a looming disaster in the\nnorthern part of the continent, and it is\nlikely the south will suffer as well.＂
＂I ask that you send reinforcements to help\n{player_name} and his people.＂
And why would I ever throw myself\ninto the line of fire like that?!
Besides, Valkaheim is way closer to the\nnorth than we are, so maybe he should...\nWait a minute.
Aaaah ha ha ha! I see how it is! Leonidas\nis providing opportunity for me to force\n{player_name} into my debt!
I doubt that that is the case, but I suppose\nall that matters is that it gives him the\nmotivation to act.
Listen up, all of you! We're forming an\nexpeditionary force and heading for\nthe north at once!
Soon, all will bow before the glory of the\ngreat and powerful Emperor Emile!
